Class BalancedBinaryTree<T>

java.lang.Object
BinaryTree<T>
BalancedBinaryTree<T>
public class BalancedBinaryTree<T>
extends BinaryTree<T>
A balanced binary tree. Replaces the add and remove operations with operations that balance the tree right after. Uses the inorder list to balance the tree and therefore mass imports should be done using the addUnbalanced operation and balancing after.
Version:
31.03.2021
Author:
VojtÄ›ch Loskot

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void add​(TreeNode<T> node)
    Adds a node to a tree and balances it
    void addUnbalanced​(TreeNode<T> node)
    Adds a node to a tree without balancing it DANGEROUS! Be sure to call balanceTree() after
    void balanceTree()
    Balances the tree by first creating an array of the tree nodes by traversing in order and then recreating the tree from that array.
    void deleteNode​(int id)
    Removes a node from a tree and balances it

    • balanceTree

      public void balanceTree()
      Balances the tree by first creating an array of the tree nodes by traversing in order and then recreating the tree from that array. This implementation is in O(n) time
